intro: Ampelocissus erdwendbergii, commonly known as the Erdwendberg fig, is a climbing plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are followed by edible fig-like fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and agroforestry systems.
